description:
'''Andrea Bocelli''' {{post-nominals|post-noms=[[Order of Merit of the Italian Republic|OMRI]] [[Order of Merit of Duarte, Sánchez and Mella|OMDSM]]}} ({{IPA|it|anˈdrɛːa boˈtʃɛlli|lang}}; born 22 September 1958) is an Italian [[tenor]]. He rose to fame in 1994 after winning the newcomers' section of the [[Sanremo Music Festival 1994|44th Sanremo Music Festival]] performing "[[Il mare calmo della sera (song)|Il mare calmo della sera]]".

Since 1994, Bocelli has recorded 15 solo studio albums of both [[Pop music|pop]] and [[classical music]], three greatest hits albums, and nine complete [[operas]], selling over 90 million records worldwide. He has had success as a [[Classical crossover|crossover]] performer, bringing classical music to the top of international pop charts. His album ''[[Romanza]]'' is one of the [[List of best selling albums|best-selling albums of all time]], while ''[[Sacred Arias (Andrea Bocelli album)|Sacred Arias]]'' is the biggest selling classical album by any solo artist in history. ''[[My Christmas]]'' was the [[Best-selling Christmas/holiday albums in the United States#2000s|best-selling holiday album of 2009]]

 and one of the [[List of best-selling Christmas albums in the United States#Best-selling Christmas albums from Nielsen SoundScan tracking data (through December 1, 2014)|best-selling holiday albums]] in the United States. The 2019 album ''[[Sì (Andrea Bocelli album)|Sì]]'' debuted at number one on the [[UK Albums Chart]] and US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], becoming Bocelli's first number-one album in both countries. His song "[[Con te partirò]]", a duet with [[Sarah Brightman]] taken from his second album ''[[Bocelli (album)|Bocelli]]'', is one of the [[List of best-selling singles|best-selling singles of all time]].

In 1998, Bocelli was named one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine's [[People (magazine)#100 Most Beautiful People|50 Most Beautiful People]]. He duetted with [[Celine Dion]] on the song "[[The Prayer (Celine Dion and Andrea Bocelli song)|The Prayer]]" for the animated film ''[[Quest for Camelot]]'', which won the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song]] and was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Original Song]]. In 1999, he was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]] at the [[Grammy Award]]s. He captured a listing in the ''[[Guinness World Records|Guinness Book of World Records]]'' with the release of his classical album ''[[Sacred Arias (Andrea Bocelli album)|Sacred Arias]]'', as he simultaneously held the top three positions on the US Classical Albums charts.

Bocelli has been blind since a football accident at age 12. He was made a Grand Officer of the [[Order of Merit of the Italian Republic]] in 2006, and was honoured with a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] on 2 March 2010, for his contribution to Live Theater, and he was awarded a gold medal for Merit in Serbia in 2022. Singer [[Celine Dion]] has said that "if [[God]] would have a singing voice, he must sound a lot like Andrea Bocelli", and record producer [[David Foster]] has often described Bocelli's voice as the most beautiful in the world.
